dialogue_turns.speaker: Listener
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, just heard about the big Eurobond listing from KazMunayGas—$1.75 billion, wow. Wondering if that'll be a hot topic at the forum next week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, just heard about the big Eurobond listing from KazMunayGas-one point seven five dollars billion, wow. Wondering if that'll be a hot topic at the forum next week?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: London Stock Exchange welcomes KazMunayGas lists $2.75bn Eurobonds

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a huge deal, right? Largest corporate bond from the CIS since 2014.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a huge deal, right? Largest corporate bond from the C I S since twenty fourteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its largest corporate bond issuance from CIS region since 2014

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's part of that whole Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum happening in Kazakhstan, um, which is actually part of Kazakhstan Mining Week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's part of that whole Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum happening in Kazakhstan, um, which is actually part of Kazakhstan Mining Week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The 6th edition of the Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum will be held in partnership with Kazenergy and Ministry of Energy of Kazakhstan and will be a part of the week-long Kazakhstan Energy Week event.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and the delegation sounds pretty stacked—like, fifteen senior reps, including folks from Shymkent and Aktau refineries.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and the delegation sounds pretty stacked-like, fifteen senior reps, including folks from Shymkent and Aktau refineries.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All in all the delegation will consist of 15 senior representatives including the heads and managers from the Modernization and Perspective Projects Department of the Kazakhstans national oil company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they've got people from Uzbekistan's national oil company too, which makes sense 'cause the event's focusing on Uzbekistan and Tajikistan this year as well.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they've got people from Uzbekistan's national oil company too, which makes sense 'cause the event's focusing on Uzbekistan and Tajikistan this year as well.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apart from Kazakhstan this year the event will focus on Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan currently very active countries when it comes to downstream.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of activity, Turkmenistan just launched a natural gas-to-diesel plant, producing like 1,500 barrels a day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of activity, Turkmenistan just launched a natural gas-to-diesel plant, producing like fifteen hundred barrels a day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Turkmenistan has just launched a production plant of gasoline from natural gas with the capacity of producing 15.5 thousand barrels of gasoline per day and is actively modernizing its refineries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, and Uzbekistan's pouring over 20 billion dollars into its refining sector through 2020, according to Kyrgyzneftegaz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, and Uzbekistan's pouring over twenty billion dollars into its refining sector through twenty twenty, according to Kyrgyzneftegaz.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Uzbekneftegaz, a programme worth 30.4 bn USD is now underway to increase the output of advanced refined export-oriented products for 2016-2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Kazakhstan's also planning a new coal mine near Karaganda, a 520 million dollar project.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Kazakhstan's also planning a new coal mine near Karaganda, a five hundred twenty million dollar project.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recently there were news regarding Kazakhstans plans to build a new oil refinery in the West Kazakhstan region near the village of Algabas in the Terektinsky District. The total cost of this project is estimated at $420 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a busy region for energy and downstream investment, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a busy region for energy and downstream investment, for sure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And if anyone's thinking of going, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a ten percent discount with promo code FORBES10.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if anyone's thinking of going, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a ten percent discount with promo code FORBES10.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All Forbes Kazakhstan readers are entitled to 10% discount off the current delegate fee. Simply apply FORBES10 promo code when registering online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Nice—more details on the globuc website, but that's a solid perk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nice-more details on the globuc website, but that's a solid perk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: What else will be discussed at the Downstream Caspian and Central Asia and more information about the event can be found here: https://globuc.com/downstream-centralasia/

artist_script:
Listener message: "Hey, just heard about the big Eurobond listing from KazMunayGas—$1.75 billion, wow. Wondering if that’ll be a hot topic at the forum next week?"
HostA: That’s a huge deal, right? Largest corporate bond from the CIS since 2014.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s part of that whole Downstream Caspian and Central Asia forum happening in Kazakhstan, um, which is actually part of Kazakhstan Mining Week.
HostA: Right, and the delegation sounds pretty stacked—like, fifteen senior reps, including folks from Shymkent and Aktau refineries.
HostB: And they’ve got people from Uzbekistan’s national oil company too, which makes sense ‘cause the event’s focusing on Uzbekistan and Tajikistan this year as well.
HostA: Speaking of activity, Turkmenistan just launched a natural gas-to-diesel plant, producing like 1,500 barrels a day.
HostB: Oh wow, and Uzbekistan’s pouring over 20 billion dollars into its refining sector through 2020, according to Kyrgyzneftegaz.
HostA: Meanwhile, Kazakhstan’s also planning a new coal mine near Karaganda, a 520 million dollar project.
HostB: It’s a busy region for energy and downstream investment, for sure.
HostA: And if anyone’s thinking of going, Forbes Kazakhstan readers get a ten percent discount with promo code FORBES10.
HostB: Nice—more details on the globuc website, but that’s a solid perk.
